Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Raniseptin PL (XXA; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, the banana tree dwelling frog,Boana platanera(Hylidae; Hylinae), Trinidad, South America

Literature Information.Literature:
Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (64.29%) tofrog Pictuseptin-3V=G: 15%; K: 19%. GRAVY: 0.203; mol Wt: 2825.332; mol formula: C131H216N32O35; mol ex coeff: 1490.Activity: active against E. coli DSM 787 (MIC 3.13 ug/ml), S. aureus
ATCC 43300 (MIC 25 ug/ml),  S. epidermidis DSM 28319 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa DSM 50071 (MIC 50 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC BAA 1705 (MIC 3.13 ug/ml), A. baumannii DSM 30008 (MIC 3.13 ug/ml),  E. faecalis MF 06036 (MIC 25 ug/ml), E. faecium NCTC 12201 (MIC 3.13 ug/ml), C. difficile R20291 or 630 BAA1382 (MIC 3.13 ug/ml).affected multiple Cancer cells A549, MDA-MB-231, HT-29: LC50 5.8-29.1 ug/ml simillar to non-cancer cells.In addition, this peptide promotes insulin secretion in acute 20-min incubations with glucose responsive BRIN-BD11 cells, thereby of interest for type 2 diabetes (T2D).Toxicity: murine RBC (HC50 262 uM), low hemo.lytic.
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Sridhar A, Khan D, Cunning TS, Delaney JJ, Taggart MG, Ternan NG, Leprince J, Coquet L, Jouenne T, Attoub S, Mechkarska M. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Multifunctional host-defense peptides isolated from skin secretions of the banana tree dwelling frog Boana platanera (Hylidae; Hylinae).
